speaker: WOMAN
line: We're so sorry, Mrs. Crouch. If there's anything we can do for you, anything, you just let us know.

speaker: WIDOW
line: Thank you so much. It would have meant a lot to him. I'm sorry. Thank you. Thank you for coming.

speaker: MAN
line: Mrs. Crouch? I'm sorry for your loss.

speaker: WIDOW
line: Thank you. Mr …

speaker: MAN
line: Johnson. I worked briefly with your husband. I was impressed by him. Very much so.

speaker: WIDOW
line: Thank you.

speaker: MAN
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: WIDOW
line: Hell of a Christmas, Raymond.

speaker: FUNERAL DIRECTOR
line: He's at peace now. That's one small comfort to be drawn.

speaker: WIDOW
line: Didn't even leave a note.

speaker: MAN
line: I am the resurrection and the life. He that believeth in me, though he were dead yet shall he live and whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die. I am the resurrection and the life. He that believeth in me, though he were dead yet shall he live and whosoever liveth and believeth in me, shall never die. I am the resurrection and the life.

speaker: MAN
line: He that believeth in me... though he were dead yet shall he live and whosoever liveth and believeth in me...shall never die. I am the resurrection and the life. He that believeth in me... though he were dead yet shall he live...

speaker: MAN
line: … whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die. He that believeth in me... though he were dead yet shall he live.

speaker: YOUNG COP
line: Thank you, ma'am.

speaker: FUNERAL DIRECTOR
line: Are you with the FBI, too?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: FUNERAL DIRECTOR
line: Look. I know my job. The man was deceased.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry?

speaker: FUNERAL DIRECTOR
line: I understand that he was one of your own -- but these rumours I'm hearing that I put a living human being into the ground... You people better get your facts straight real fast.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, have you been spreading rumours?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why? You hear any good ones lately?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not particularly. So what do you have here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Merry Christmas, by the way, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you. Merry Christmas to you, too.

speaker: MULDER
line: Grave robbery with a twist. Check out the headliner, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It looks like someone on the inside was trying to get out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Indeed it does. To answer your question -- no, I haven't been spreading any rumours. The local PD's been doing a pretty good job of that ever since they matched the fingerprints of the dead man to these. And to those up there on that headstone. There's a big juicy handprint on the back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What about the person or persons who did the digging?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, got one pile of dirt. I'm guessing one man with a shovel. Other than that last night's rain hasn't left us much to go on. Well, go ahead, Scully, naysay me. The body of an FBI agent gets disinterred only to climb out on its own and disappear into the Yuletide night.

speaker: SCULLY
line: See, you had me up until there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did I?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think it's what you said before. I think it's a grave robbery with a twist. You've got the fingerprints and the torn casket liner. Most likely it's rigged evidence that's been faked by whoever exhumed the body.

speaker: MULDER
line: Faked for what effect?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Publicity... fear... rumours... I mean, I don't know what specific effect, but nonetheless it's... What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Looks like blood.

speaker: MAN
line: And whosoever believeth and liveth in me shall never die. I am the resurrection and the life. He that believeth in me, though He be dead, yet shall he live and whosoever believeth and Liveth in me shall never die.

speaker: MAN
line: I am the resurrection and the life. He that believeth in me, though He be dead, yet shall he live and whosoever believeth and Liveth in me shall never die. I am the resurrection and the life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Special Agent Raymond Crouch, Age 56, married, no children. After a sterling 21-year career with the Bureau, he retired in 1993. And, then earlier this month, he was found in the garage of his Tallahassee home, service weapon in hand.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Definitely self-inflicted?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I read over the report and there's no indication otherwise.

speaker: SKINNER
line: How about a motive for the grave robberies?

speaker: MALE AGENT
line: We've gone through all the cases Crouch had a hand in. He doesn't seem to have made any enemies.

speaker: FEMALE AGENT
line: Same thing with his personal life. No large debts, no feuds with neighbors, never a bad word against him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Nothing stands out?

speaker: MULDER
line: Should something stand out?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder, what's your take on this?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, only that I don't think it was grave robbery per se. It was necromancy.

speaker: MULDER
line: The summoning of the dead. It's a form of magic dating back to primitive Shamanism with a long tradition in the Christian church. Through it, the dead are brought back to life for the purposes of divulging arcane knowledge or performing ritual tasks.

speaker: MALE AGENT
line: So, that's what this wacko thought he was doing? Raising the dead?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, that's what he was doing. This is a, uh... that's a magic circle drawn in goat's blood. The rain washed most of it away. The blood attracts the spirits of the undead while the circle focuses the necromancer's power while protecting him from the spirits that he's conjuring.

speaker: MALE AGENT
line: Okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: He may also desire to wear the clothes of the dead man to create a bond between them. You would not want to be this man's dry cleaner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Obviously, there are clear ritualistic elements to this crime. But the question is why were they directed at Raymond Crouch?

speaker: MULDER
line: That is the question.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, let's come up with an answer.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Mulder, Scully, a word, please.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Necromancy aside... this magic circle you mentioned -- what if it looked something like this?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's an ouroboros... Possibly. Definitely a mystical symbol. The alchemists favored it. They believe that it represented all of existence.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm thinking more the Millennium Group. It was their symbol as well. Are you familiar with them?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, somewhat. They were former FBI agents who offered consulting services to law enforcement. Somehow, they fell into disrepute.

speaker: SKINNER
line: They operated in extreme secrecy. Rumours abounded that they had their own agenda which was less than altruistic if not improper or illegal.

speaker: MULDER
line: And that it was, in fact, a cult based upon Judeo-Christian "Endtime" prophecies concerning the coming millennium. Was Raymond Crouch a member?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I can't seem to find out. Apparently the group dissolved several months ago. They left no paper trail -- nothing. However... I do have three other grave desecrations all within the last six months. Long Island... Northern California, Arizona. All three graves contained the bodies of former FBI agents. All three were recent suicides.

speaker: MULDER
line: How long were you going to sit on this?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Owing to the Millennium Group's former ties with the Bureau this matter is … sensitive, to say the least. Investigate them. Keep a low profile.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think I know where to start.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How well do you know this man?

speaker: MULDER
line: Only by reputation. He left, um, Vi-Cap before I got there. But he's been called the greatest criminal profiler that Quantico ever produced.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's he doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Good morning. Apparently, he checked himself in for a 30 day observation. I gather the last few years haven't been very kind to him. If there's anybody that can tell us about the Millennium Group, it's him. He used to consult for them. Later, he fought to bring them down at the expense of his own career and reputation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Single-minded.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sounds like someone I know.

speaker: TV ANNOUNCER
line: ... 12 yard line and they are threatening... pounding on the door of Boston College.

speaker: MULDER
line: Frank Black?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi, my name is, uh, Fox Mulder. This is my partner, Dana Scully. It's a pleasure to meet you. Do you mind if we sit down?

speaker: TV ANNOUNCER
line: Higgins tries the middle and he gets... nowhere. Running into the grey wall of Boston.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who's playing?

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Uh, it's Notre Dame and Boston College.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ah, the Fighting Irish and the Golden Eagles, huh?

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: What can I do for you, agents?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, we're working on a case that, uh, we feel that you might have some particular insight into -- the deaths of four FBI agents. Do you recognize these men?

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: I do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All four committed suicide in the last six months. All were exhumed from their graves in a ritual desecration. They were members of the Millennium Group. Is that correct?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, we've been having a really difficult time gleaning any information whatsoever about the group... about its membership, its practices... I believe you can help us.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: No, thank you. I'm retired. I think you can tell by the circumstances that I'm trying to put my life back together. I can't get involved in this.

speaker: MULDER
line: We're not asking you to get involved. I'm just asking you to take a look at the case file.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: No, thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. Black, the day after tomorrow is January 1, 2000. That's the significant date for these people. That doesn't leave us much time. Don't you want to see them stopped?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, Mr. Black, you are not what I was expecting.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Agent Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: It's first and 18. Just let me watch this game in peace.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's third and ten. It's third and ten, Notre Dame.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Happy New Year.

speaker: MULDER
line: Same to you.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: Evening.

speaker: MAN
line: Hi.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: Could I, uh, give you a hand?

speaker: MAN
line: Oh, no. I'm about done, but thanks. Guess I ran over a nail or something.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: Well, I can help you see, at least.

speaker: MAN
line: Yeah, I've been driving all night. Be good to get home.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: I hear you.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: Man... Whew. What is that?

speaker: MAN
line: Oh, yeah. I think a deer maybe must've died out there in the woods.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: Sir? What's in the truck?

speaker: MAN
line: Nothing.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: Mind if I take a look?

speaker: MAN
line: There's nothing in there, so...

speaker: DEPUTY
line: Drop that and take two steps back. Drop it.

speaker: MAN
line: He who believeth in me, though he be dead, yet shall he live and whosoever believeth and liveth in me shall never die. I am the resurrection and the life.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: Oh, Lord! Stand up there! Stand up! Let me see your hands.

speaker: MAN
line: I am the resurrection...

speaker: DEPUTY
line: What?

speaker: MAN
line: He who believeth in me, though...

speaker: DEPUTY
line: Speak up!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey. I've got the men concentrating on the woods.

speaker: MULDER
line: Our necromancer was definitely here. It's salt. Heavy magic.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, if you're going to tell me that he, uh, stopped by the side of the road to raise the dead, which I hope you're not, I've got two things to say to you. One is that his previous circles were made of blood, not salt, and two...

speaker: MULDER
line: And they were large enough to contain a body. This is just a protective circle. It's just big enough for one man to stand inside.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Protecting himself against what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Whatever it was that did that.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Agents! Over here!

speaker: SHERIFF
line: I saw a lump in the ground.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: My God...

speaker: MULDER
line: Bite marks. They look human.

speaker: SCULLY
line: More salt.

speaker: MULDER
line: "I am he that liveth and was dead; and, behold, I am alive for evermore, amen; And have the keys of hell and of death."

speaker: YOUNG COP WHO KNOWS THE BIBLE
line: Book of Revelation chapter one, verse 18.

speaker: MULDER
line: Go Fighting Irish.

speaker: MULDER
line: First and 18. It's not football, it's Revelations. You wanted to tell us something, Frank. Why don't you just come out and say it?

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: I don't know what you're talking about. I told you, I cannot get involved in this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Right, so you'll occasionally drop the little arcane hint? A police officer was murdered, Frank. Why do you want to play around? Your denial's a sign that you obviously know something about that. You knew that we'd find this. What are you afraid of?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Losing your daughter. You're in a custody battle with the parents of your late wife. I just spoke with your doctor. That's why you're here.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: They claimed I was an unfit father, that I was obsessed with conspiracy, the end of the world, that my work meant more to me than my daughter, Jordan. The thing is... they were right.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And so you retired.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: I will sell insurance. I'll do whatever it takes. I'll get well and I'll jump through whatever hoops they want, but I will not mention the Millennium Group again.

speaker: MULDER
line: But you obviously want to help. You... dropped that clue on us. Look, Frank, nobody needs to know about this. We're just three people sitting around talking.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: The Book of Revelation describes the end of the physical world in a battle between heaven and hell... Good against Evil. The Millennium Group believed that that time was upon us. These four represent a schism in the group. They believe that for the end time to come, as it must that man must take an active hand in bringing that about.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And to that end, they committed suicide.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: With the express purpose of being brought back to life. The Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse. These four men bring with them war, pestilence, famine and death.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: So that all the dead of the earth will arise -- Armageddon. It must begin with the dawn of the millennium... or not at all. That's what they believe. The man you're looking for -- your necromancer -- he exhumed these men in accordance with their wishes.

speaker: MULDER
line: So is he a member of the Millennium Group as well?

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: No, they sought him out. He believes he's doing God's work but he's mistaken.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Could you tell us a little bit more about this man?

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: He's a white male, 45 to 50. He's a religious man, no police record... no fulfilling relationship. You would pass him without giving him a glance.

speaker: MULDER
line: So this is the one event that'll give his life meaning.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Yeah. He needs privacy for this. He'll live alone... possibly in the house he grew up in. Most likely it's a large rural property away from prying eyes. He'll own a truck or a van. He needs it to transport the bodies. There'll be high fences, "No Trespassing" signs. It's a solitary existence. He's worked around death all his life in some capacity -- a funeral parlor or a cemetery. Death comforts him.

speaker: TV NEWS ANNOUNCER
line: A Rice County sheriff's deputy...

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: … He took great care in burying the deputy and preparing the body despite the fact that he feared being caught. He stapled the lips, sealed the mouth shut. It was to prevent the man from coming back to life. He believes, that if disturbed the deputy will rise from the dead. It's too soon for that, which is why when he realizes that the deputy has been discovered he'll feel a need to take action. He'll return to the body the first chance he gets.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Rice County morgue.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: I think you'll catch him there.

speaker: MULDER
line: These four members of the Millennium Group... the ones that "truly liveth who were dead." These are the ones we have to catch.

speaker: NURSE
line: Mr. Black?

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Yeah?

speaker: NURSE
line: You've got a phone call. I think it might be your daughter.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Thank you. My daughter. Excuse me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you're telling me it's more important to track down four dead bodies than one live murderer.

speaker: MULDER
line: He's not our murderer, and those four dead bodies aren't dead and the millennium is … … 14 hours away.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, those people, even when they were alive mangled biblical prophecy to the extent that it's unrecognizable. The year 2000 is just their artificial deadline and besides, 2001 is actually the start of the new millennium.

speaker: MULDER
line: Nobody likes a math geek, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Anyway, I think that Frank's profile is sound.

speaker: MULDER
line: I do, too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And I think with it we have our best chance of finding this necromancer, as you call him. So I am going down to the county morgue.

speaker: MULDER
line: I absolutely think you should.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And what are you going to do?

speaker: MULDER
line: Follow the profile. The deputy was killed on a road that connects from the north with no major highway. I'm thinking our necromancer lives nearby. I'm going to do a rundown on all single landowners in the area see where the bodies are buried, since we all... Oh, Scully, will you do me a favor? Don't let anybody remove the staples from the deputy's mouth, okay? Please? Just humor me. Thanks.

speaker: CORONER
line: Proceeding with the visual examination of the mouth.

speaker: CORONER
line: Geez.

speaker: CORONER
line: What appears to be salt is packed into the victim's mouth.

speaker: CORONER
line: God only knows why. I'm removing it.

speaker: ANSWERING MACHINE
line: This is the Rice County morgue. No one can come to the phone.

speaker: SCULLY'S VOICE
line: This is Agent Dana Scully with the FBI. Please do not autopsy the murder victim that was brought in earlier -- the sheriff's deputy. If you've already started, stop now. I'll be there shortly and I'll explain when I arrive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Where is she?

speaker: SHERIFF
line: On the right.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: How are you feeling?

speaker: SCULLY
line: All things considered...?

speaker: SKINNER
line: What the hell happened here? Who is that man?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The Sheriff's Deputy. The man we found this morning. He was dead and then, somehow, he wasn't. He attacked me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You shot him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Three rounds center-of-mass into his chest. No effect.

speaker: SKINNER
line: There's a gunshot wound to his head as well.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, this man, uh, Mulder calls a "necromancer," our suspect, he was here, too. He fired that shot with my gun. He saved me. I have no idea why. He got away but I was in no shape to follow. Look, sir, I can't even begin to offer an explanation for what happened but I have to say it is exactly what Mulder feared.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yeah, which is why I would like to talk to him. Why isn't he answering his phone?

speaker: MULDER
line: Welcome to the boondocks.

speaker: MAN
line: In the sweet by and by, we will meet on that beautiful shore.

speaker: MULDER
line: Open the door! Open the door! Open it! Let me out! Let me out!

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: I haven't heard from him. He didn't go to the morgue with you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, he went looking for our suspect's home. No one's been able to contact him since. I've got task force agents canvassing the northwestern Maryland area but it's a large territory to cover and we're running out of time. Sir, I'm just afraid that Mulder may have found what he's looking for. I need your help in finding him.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Now, you respected my reasons in the past, Agent Scully. Please respect them now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not sure that I really understand your reasons, sir, and I'm starting to wonder what this is all about and how much you know about it. Mulder mentioned the four Millennium members who "liveth and were dead." Now, this morning in the morgue, I saw what he was talking about.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: You did?

speaker: SCULLY
line: One of them attacked me.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Now, as crazy as this sounds, I have to ask. Do you believe that the Millennium Group is actually capable of bringing about the Endtime? Armageddon?

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: I understand their beliefs. I've spent years trying to unravel them, make sense of them. Doesn't mean I believe them myself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But what if it were true? Good and evil -- which would prevail?

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Octavia, I'm going to check myself out.

speaker: NURSE
line: You'd like a day pass?

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: I won't be coming back.

speaker: MAN
line: Who's there?

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: It's me.

speaker: MAN
line: You came.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: I almost didn't.

speaker: MAN
line: We'd given up on you. Thank God. Thank God. There's someone in the basement... policeman. He killed one of the members. Shot him in the head. But you're here. Now we'll have four.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: I'm here.

speaker: MAN
line: I can't tell you how happy I am. You were meant to be the fourth. I always knew that. I'd so hoped you'd come around.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: I didn't want to. The man in the basement? I told him how to find this place.

speaker: MAN
line: You... why?

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: I was trying to walk the straight and narrow. Leave the Millennium Group behind. But I know I can't do that anymore. Now that I know you've succeeded.

speaker: MAN
line: You didn't believe the dead would arise?

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: No.

speaker: MAN
line: You see what the future holds, Frank. You know you can't run from it.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: No, I can't run.

speaker: MAN
line: You've paid so dearly. They've taken your daughter from you. Murdered your wife... there's no justice in this world.

speaker: MAN
line: But there will be in the next.

speaker: MAN
line: The hour's near. Are you ready, Frank?

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: I'm ready.

speaker: MAN
line: I am the resurrection and the life. He that believeth in me, though he were dead...

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: … yet shall he live. Whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully.

speaker: SKINNER
line: This is Skinner. We back-checked Frank Black as you asked.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And?

speaker: SKINNER
line: He took no calls at Hartwell Psychiatric other than from his daughter, but the staff took messages including one from a Rice County number.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Rice County? That's where I am right now.

speaker: SKINNER
line: We ran the phone records for Agent Crouch and the other desecration victims. All four received calls from this same number in weeks before their deaths.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm going to need an address.

speaker: MAN
line: Don't do this. I'm begging you, please. You know what the world is. Evil goes unpunished. The good suffer. There's no future here but uncertainty and pain. Let the judgment come! You're damning yourself, Frank!

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Agent Mulder? Can you hear me? Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah... I'm down here. They're all around.

speaker: MULDER
line: You armed?

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Oh, yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Shoot for the head. That seems to stop 'em. There's three more of 'em.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Where?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. They're hiding.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Mulder, can you get up?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, I think so.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look out!

speaker: DICK CLARK
line: There's another shot of that millennium crystal ball all lit up. They're getting ready to bring in the New Year. Boy, are they packed in tonight. The body heat alone is keeping them warm. And look at them -- all the way up past 52nd street. That is that X-shaped thing I was talking about before. This is Times Square -- the crossroads of the world...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Black.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Hi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mike Johnson's been taken for psychiatric evaluation. He'll be put under suicide watch just as you asked.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Good.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And, um...

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's someone here to see you.

speaker: JORDAN
line: Hi, Daddy!

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Hi, little one! Oh, I missed you, Sweetheart.

speaker: JORDAN
line: I missed you, too, Daddy.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Let's get out of here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Frank, good luck with everything.

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Agent Mulder, Agent Scully. I guess this is it, huh?

speaker: DICK CLARK
line: … The ball is on its way...

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're not going to stay and watch?

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: No, we just want to go home.

speaker: DICK CLARK
line: What a millennium...

speaker: FRANK BLACK
line: Take care of yourselves.

speaker: DICK CLARK
line: … 30 seconds now, 30. Get ready for the loudest cheering you'll ever hear in your life. Hug your friends and loved ones tight. What the heck, whoever that person is next to you. No time like the present. Are you ready? Here we go. Ten, nine... eight, seven, six... five, four, three, two, one... Happy New Year, 2000!

speaker: TV MUSIC
line: Should auld acquaintance be forgot and days of auld lang syne …

speaker: MULDER
line: The world didn't end.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, it didn't.

speaker: MULDER
line: Happy New Year, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Happy New Year, Mulder.
